channel.title: Security on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Security on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: Google finds custom backdoor being installed on SonicWall network devices
item.description: Overstep backdoor nukes key log entries, making detection hard.

item.title: DHS Faces New Pressure Over DNA Taken From Immigrant Children
item.description: The US government has added the DNA of approximately 133,000 migrant children and teens to a criminal database, which critics say could mean police treat them like suspects “indefinitely.”

item.title: DHS Faces New Pressure Over DNA Taken From Immigrant Children
item.description: The US government has added the DNA of approximately 133,000 migrant children and teens to a criminal database, which critics say could mean police treat them like suspects “indefinitely.”

item.title: Adoption Agency Data Exposure Revealed Information About Children and Parents
item.description: A trove of 1.1 million records left accessible on the open web shows how much sensitive information can be created—and made vulnerable—during the adoption process.

item.title: Adoption Agency Data Exposure Revealed Information About Children and Parents
item.description: A trove of 1.1 million records left accessible on the open web shows how much sensitive information can be created—and made vulnerable—during the adoption process.

item.title: Hackers exploit a blind spot by hiding malware inside DNS records
item.description: Technique transforms the Internet DNS into an unconventional file storage system.

item.title: The FBI's Jeffrey Epstein Prison Video Had Nearly 3 Minutes Cut Out
item.description: Metadata from the “raw” Epstein prison video shows approximately 2 minutes and 53 seconds were removed from one of two stitched-together clips. The cut starts right at the “missing minute.”

item.title: The FBI's Jeffrey Epstein Prison Video Had Nearly 3 Minutes Cut Out
item.description: Metadata from the “raw” Epstein prison video shows approximately 2 minutes and 53 seconds were removed from one of two stitched-together clips. The cut starts right at the “missing minute.”

item.title: ICEBlock isn’t ‘completely anonymous’
item.description: The developer of ICEBlock, an iOS app for anonymously reporting sightings of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officials, promises that it “ensures user privacy by storing no personal data.

item.title: ICEBlock isn’t ‘completely anonymous’
item.description: The developer of ICEBlock, an iOS app for anonymously reporting sightings of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officials, promises that it “ensures user privacy by storing no personal data.

item.title: Nvidia chips become the first GPUs to fall to Rowhammer bit-flip attacks
item.description: GPUhammer is the first to flip bits in onboard GPU memory. It likely won’t be the last.

item.title: AI 'Nudify' Websites Are Raking in Millions of Dollars
item.description: Millions of people are accessing harmful AI “nudify” websites. New analysis says the sites are making millions and rely on tech from US companies.

item.title: AI 'Nudify' Websites Are Raking in Millions of Dollars
item.description: Millions of people are accessing harmful AI “nudify” websites. New analysis says the sites are making millions and rely on tech from US companies.

item.title: New Windows 11 build adds self-healing “quick machine recovery” feature
item.description: New recovery mode lets Microsoft fix “widespread boot issues” affecting PCs.

item.title: Metadata Shows the FBI’s ‘Raw’ Jeffrey Epstein Prison Video Was Likely Modified
item.description: There is no evidence the footage was deceptively manipulated, but ambiguities around how the video was processed may further fuel conspiracy theories about Epstein’s death.

item.title: Metadata Shows the FBI’s ‘Raw’ Jeffrey Epstein Prison Video Was Likely Modified
item.description: There is no evidence the footage was deceptively manipulated, but ambiguities around how the video was processed may further fuel conspiracy theories about Epstein’s death.

item.title: DHS Tells Police That Common Protest Activities Are ‘Violent Tactics’
item.description: DHS is urging law enforcement to treat even skateboarding and livestreaming as signs of violent intent during a protest, turning everyday behavior into a pretext for police action.

item.title: DHS Tells Police That Common Protest Activities Are ‘Violent Tactics’
item.description: DHS is urging law enforcement to treat even skateboarding and livestreaming as signs of violent intent during a protest, turning everyday behavior into a pretext for police action.

item.title: Pro basketball player and 4 youths arrested in connection to ransomware crimes
item.description: Suspects were allegedly involved in a string of ransomware breaches.
